verses.kjv: The word that the LORD spake against Babylon and against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.ct: This is the message the LORD spoke through the prophet Jeremiah against Babylon and the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: Declare ye among the nations, and publish, and set up a standard; publish, and conceal not: say, Babylon is taken, Bel is confounded, Merodach is broken in pieces; her idols are confounded, her images are broken in pieces.
verses.ct: "Announce it among the nations! Proclaim it and raise a signal flag! Proclaim it and don't hold anything back! Say: 'Babylon has been captured! Bel is humiliated, Merodach is shattered! Her idols are disgraced, her images are smashed to pieces.'"

verses.kjv: For out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate, and none shall dwell therein: they shall remove, they shall depart, both man and beast.
verses.ct: A nation from the north is advancing against her, and it will turn her land into a wasteland. No one will live there — both people and animals will flee and be gone.

verses.kjv: In those days, and in that time, saith the LORD, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Judah together, going and weeping: they shall go, and seek the LORD their God.
verses.ct: "In those days and at that time," says the LORD, "the people of Israel and the people of Judah will come together, weeping as they go, searching for the LORD their God."

verses.kjv: They shall ask the way to Zion with their faces thitherward, saying, Come, and let us join ourselves to the LORD in a perpetual covenant that shall not be forgotten.
verses.ct: They will ask for directions to Zion, heading that way, saying, 'Come, let's bind ourselves to the LORD in an everlasting covenant that will never be forgotten.'

verses.kjv: My people hath been lost sheep: their shepherds have caused them to go astray, they have turned them away on the mountains: they have gone from mountain to hill, they have forgotten their restingplace.
verses.ct: "My people have been like lost sheep. Their leaders led them astray, causing them to wander through the mountains. They roamed from mountain to hill and forgot where their resting place was."

verses.kjv: All that found them have devoured them: and their adversaries said, We offend not, because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of justice, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.
verses.ct: Everyone who found them devoured them, and their enemies said, 'We're not guilty, because they sinned against the LORD, the dwelling place of righteousness — the LORD, the hope of their ancestors.'

verses.kjv: Remove out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the he goats before the flocks.
verses.ct: "Flee from Babylon! Leave the land of the Chaldeans! Be like the lead goats that go ahead of the flock."

verses.kjv: For, lo, I will raise and cause to come up against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the north country: and they shall set themselves in array against her; from thence she shall be taken: their arrows shall be as of a mighty expert man; none shall return in vain.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am going to stir up and bring against Babylon an alliance of powerful nations from the northern lands. They will line up in battle formation against her, and from there she will be captured. Their arrows will be like those of a skilled warrior — none will miss their mark."

verses.kjv: And Chaldea shall be a spoil: all that spoil her shall be satisfied, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Chaldea will be plundered, and everyone who loots her will get their fill," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Because ye were glad, because ye rejoiced, O ye destroyers of mine heritage, because ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass, and bellow as bulls;
verses.ct: "Because you celebrated, because you rejoiced, you who pillaged my inheritance — because you frolic like a calf in a meadow and neigh like stallions —

verses.kjv: Your mother shall be sore confounded; she that bare you shall be ashamed: behold, the hindermost of the nations shall be a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
verses.ct: your mother will be deeply disgraced; the one who gave birth to you will be put to shame. Look — she will become the least of the nations, a wilderness, a dry and barren desert."

verses.kjv: Because of the wrath of the LORD it shall not be inhabited, but it shall be wholly desolate: every one that goeth by Babylon shall be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.
verses.ct: Because of the LORD's anger, it will be left uninhabited and completely desolate. Everyone who passes by Babylon will be horrified and gasp at all her wounds.

verses.kjv: Put yourselves in array against Babylon round about: all ye that bend the bow, shoot at her, spare no arrows: for she hath sinned against the LORD.
verses.ct: "Take your battle positions around Babylon! All you archers, shoot at her! Don't hold back your arrows, because she has sinned against the LORD."

verses.kjv: Shout against her round about: she hath given her hand: her foundations are fallen, her walls are thrown down: for it is the vengeance of the LORD: take vengeance upon her; as she hath done, do unto her.
verses.ct: "Raise the war cry against her on every side! She has surrendered! Her foundations have crumbled, her walls have been torn down. This is the LORD's vengeance — take your revenge on her! Do to her exactly what she has done to others."

verses.kjv: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to his people, and they shall flee every one to his own land.
verses.ct: "Eliminate the one who plants seed in Babylon and the one who swings the sickle at harvest time. Because of the threat of the invader's sword, everyone will run back to their own people, and each one will escape to their own country."

verses.kjv: Israel is a scattered sheep; the lions have driven him away: first the king of Assyria hath devoured him; and last this Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones.
verses.ct: "Israel is a scattered sheep that lions have chased away. First, the king of Assyria devoured him, and then finally Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon crushed his bones."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "I am going to punish the king of Babylon and his land, just as I punished the king of Assyria."

verses.kjv: And I will bring Israel again to his habitation, and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul shall be satisfied upon mount Ephraim and Gilead.
verses.ct: "I will bring Israel back to his own pastureland, and he will graze on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and Gilead."

verses.kjv: In those days, and in that time, saith the LORD, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon them whom I reserve.
verses.ct: "In those days and at that time," says the LORD, "people will search for Israel's guilt, but there will be none. They will look for Judah's sins, but they won't be found, because I will forgive the remnant I preserve."

verses.kjv: Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod: waste and utterly destroy after them, saith the LORD, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.
verses.ct: "March against the land of Merathaim — attack it! Go against the people of Pekod! Completely destroy them all," says the LORD. "Carry out everything I have commanded you."

verses.kjv: A sound of battle is in the land, and of great destruction.
verses.ct: The sound of battle fills the land — the noise of massive destruction!

verses.kjv: How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!
verses.ct: How the hammer that struck the whole earth has been cut apart and shattered! How Babylon has become a horror among the nations!

verses.kjv: I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware: thou art found, and also caught, because thou hast striven against the LORD.
verses.ct: "I set a trap for you, Babylon, and you were caught before you even realized it. You were discovered and seized because you fought against the LORD."

verses.kjv: The LORD hath opened his armoury, and hath brought forth the weapons of his indignation: for this is the work of the Lord GOD of hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.ct: The LORD has opened his armory and brought out the weapons of his fury, because the Lord GOD of hosts has work to do in the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: Come against her from the utmost border, open her storehouses: cast her up as heaps, and destroy her utterly: let nothing of her be left.
verses.ct: "Come against her from every direction! Break open her storehouses! Pile her up like heaps of grain and completely destroy her. Let nothing remain."

verses.kjv: Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.
verses.ct: "Kill all her young bulls; send them to the slaughter! How terrible for them, because their day has arrived — the time of their punishment!"

verses.kjv: The voice of them that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God, the vengeance of his temple.
verses.ct: Listen to the refugees fleeing and escaping from the land of Babylon, coming to announce in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God — vengeance for his temple.

verses.kjv: Call together the archers against Babylon: all ye that bend the bow, camp against it round about; let none thereof escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she hath done, do unto her: for she hath been proud against the LORD, against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: "Summon the archers against Babylon! All you who draw the bow, surround her camp — don't let anyone escape! Pay her back for what she has done; do to her everything she did to others, because she acted arrogantly against the LORD, against the Holy One of Israel."

verses.kjv: Therefore shall her young men fall in the streets, and all her men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "That is why her young men will fall in her streets, and all her soldiers will be silenced on that day," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against thee, O thou most proud, saith the Lord GOD of hosts: for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
verses.ct: "I am against you, you arrogant one," declares the Lord GOD of hosts, "because your day has come — the time when I will deal with you."

verses.kjv: And the most proud shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up: and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all round about him.
verses.ct: "The arrogant one will stumble and collapse, and no one will help him back up. I will set fire to his cities, and it will consume everything around him."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; The children of Israel and the children of Judah were oppressed together: and all that took them captives held them fast; they refused to let them go.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD of hosts says: "The people of Israel and the people of Judah are oppressed together. All who captured them hold them tight and refuse to release them."

verses.kjv: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.ct: "But their Redeemer is powerful — the LORD of hosts is his name. He will vigorously defend their case so that he may bring peace to the land and turmoil to the people of Babylon."

verses.kjv: A sword is upon the Chaldeans, saith the LORD, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.
verses.ct: "A sword is coming against the Chaldeans," says the LORD, "against the residents of Babylon, against her officials, and against her wise advisors."

verses.kjv: A sword is upon the liars; and they shall dote: a sword is upon her mighty men; and they shall be dismayed.
verses.ct: "A sword is coming against her false prophets — they will become fools! A sword is coming against her warriors — they will be filled with terror!"

verses.kjv: A sword is upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon all the mingled people that are in the midst of her; and they shall become as women: a sword is upon her treasures; and they shall be robbed.
verses.ct: "A sword is coming against their horses and chariots, and against all the foreign troops within her — they will become weak as cowards! A sword is coming against her treasuries — they will be looted!"

verses.kjv: A drought is upon her waters; and they shall be dried up: for it is the land of graven images, and they are mad upon their idols.
verses.ct: "A drought is coming on her waters, and they will dry up, because it is a land full of carved idols, and the people are crazed over their disgusting images."

verses.kjv: Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wild beasts of the islands shall dwell there, and the owls shall dwell therein: and it shall be no more inhabited for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
verses.ct: "That is why desert creatures and hyenas will live there, and ostriches will inhabit it. It will never be populated again; no one will live there through all future generations."

verses.kjv: As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the LORD; so shall no man abide there, neither shall any son of man dwell therein.
verses.ct: "Just as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring towns," says the LORD, "no one will settle there, and no human being will live in it."

verses.kjv: Behold, a people shall come from the north, and a great nation, and many kings shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.
verses.ct: "Look — a people is coming from the north! A great nation and many kings are being mobilized from the distant parts of the earth."

verses.kjv: They shall hold the bow and the lance: they are cruel, and will not shew mercy: their voice shall roar like the sea, and they shall ride upon horses, every one put in array, like a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
verses.ct: "They carry bows and spears. They are ruthless and show no mercy. Their roar is like the crashing sea. They ride on horses, lined up in battle formation like one warrior — coming against you, daughter of Babylon."

verses.kjv: The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them, and his hands waxed feeble: anguish took hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.
verses.ct: The king of Babylon has heard the reports about them, and his hands went limp. Anguish gripped him — pain like a woman in labor.

verses.kjv: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan unto the habitation of the strong: but I will make them suddenly run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?
verses.ct: "Like a lion coming up from the thick brush along the Jordan to rich pastureland, I will suddenly chase them away from her. And who is the chosen one I will appoint over her? For who is like me? Who can challenge me? What leader can stand against me?"

verses.kjv: Therefore hear ye the counsel of the LORD, that he hath taken against Babylon; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitation desolate with them.
verses.ct: "So listen to the plan the LORD has made against Babylon, the strategies he has devised against the land of the Chaldeans: Even the weakest of the flock will drag them away. He will surely turn their homeland into a wasteland because of them."

verses.kjv: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth is moved, and the cry is heard among the nations.
verses.ct: At the sound of Babylon's capture, the earth trembles, and the outcry echoes among the nations.
